intro: Hieracium lachenalii, commonly known as the Lachenal's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium lachenalii is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
